definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: The news of her divorce gradually rippled outwards.
sentences.chinese: 她離婚的消息漸漸向外傳開。

sentences.english: "I'm a divorce lawyer," the man replies.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我是一個專辦離婚案的律師。

sentences.english: In nineteen eighty, the American divorce rate was about fifty percent.
sentences.chinese: 在一九八四，美國的離婚率是百分之五十左右。
2008年4月17日，陳勇軍和王莉協議離婚了。

sentences.english: More often than not, divorcees in this age group will likely have a young child at home.
sentences.chinese: 通常，這個年齡段離婚的人已生有子女。

sentences.english: Yes, they got divorced, for his wife was unstable as water.
sentences.chinese: 是的，他們離婚了，因爲他的妻子水性楊花。

sentences.english: That means when the judge decided how the property would be divided in the divorce.
sentences.chinese: 那就是說離婚時當法官作出決定財產是如何劃分的。

sentences.english: After divorce, the two became strangers and do not say a word to each other.
sentences.chinese: 離婚以後就成了陌路人，誰也不理誰了。

sentences.english: And for those who find their fears were justified, many head straight to divorce court.
sentences.chinese: 那些證實了自己的疑懼的人，很多直接步入離婚法庭。

sentences.english: She re married her former husband ten year after their divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她與原來的丈夫離婚十年後又復婚了。

sentences.english: Tle enforced divorce law forbids dividing individuals by force.
sentences.chinese: 實施的離婚法禁止強行分開個體。

sentences.english: The Norwegian government is stepping in to reduce the nation's 40-percent divorce rate.
sentences.chinese: 挪威政府正採取措施降低本國40%的離婚率。

sentences.english: Dong Yun Zhou Siwei wife has filed for divorce at this time, he refused to sign it.
sentences.chinese: 周斯偉的妻子董芸卻在此時提出離婚，他拒絕簽字。

sentences.english: After this statement, we will not make any response to divorce matters.
sentences.chinese: 本聲明以後，我們將不會就離婚事宜再作任何迴應。

sentences.english: The global implications of this divorce are huge.
sentences.chinese: 這場離婚案的全球影響力是巨大的。

definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
